Intervention: FEC, followed by paclitaxel, is administered in combination with bevacizumab for approximately 3 to 12 months.
5-Fluorouracil 600 mg/m^2 i.v. bolus 15 min; epirubin 90 mg/m^2 i.v. 1 hour infusion; cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m^2 i.v. 1 hour infusion every 3 weeks for 4 cycles.
Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m^2 i.v. more than one hour per week for 12 weeks.
Bevacizumab: 10 mg/kg i.v. every 2 weeks for 6 cycles.
Eligibility: Stage III or inflammatory breast cancer;
- positive or negative estrogen receptor/progesterone receptor (ER/PgR) and negative human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER-2);
Other primary tumours in the last 5 years (except for properly treated cancer in situ of the cervix, or basal cell skin cancer);
Chronic daily treatment with > 325 milligrams of aspirin per day (mg/day) or > 75 mg/day of clopidogrel.
Results: Percentage of participants with a complete pathological response as a result of the Principal Investigator review
A complete pathological response was defined as the absence of invasive neoplastic cells during microscopic examination of tumour remains after surgery after primary systemic treatment.
Description of the arm/group: FEC, followed by paclitaxel, given in combination with bevacizumab for approximately 3-12 months.
5-Fluorouracil 600 mg/m^2 i.v. bolus 15 min; epirubin 90 mg/m^2 i.v. 1 hour infusion; cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m^2 i.v. 1 hour infusion every 3 weeks for 4 cycles.
Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m^2 i.v. more than one hour per week for 12 weeks.
Bevacizumab: 10 mg/kg i.v. every 2 weeks for 6 cycles.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 23.2
